content.question: Which of the following accurately describes the effect of the spread of Christianity among most Amerindian societies after 1500 C.E.?

choices.label: Christianity completely supplanted Amerindian religious beliefs and practices shortly after the conquest.
Amerindians maintained local customs by combining indigenous beliefs with elements of Christianity.
Amerindiansâ€™ resistance to Christianity resulted in widespread European conversions to indigenous religions.
Amerindian religious beliefs and practices were respected by Europeans who considered them equal to Christian beliefs and practices.

content.answer: Amerindians maintained local customs by combining indigenous beliefs with elements of Christianity.
